name: outer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 at a greater distance from the centre: outer London the outer lane of the motorway
More examplesFewer examplesIce had formed around the outer edge of the pond.The telescope can view the outer reaches of the solar system.They live on the outer edge of the city.The outer leaves of the cabbage should be removed.The outer layer of the jacket is waterproof.

on the outside, or at a greater distance from the center or inside: an outer covering/layer A line of trees marks the outer edge of the property.
